meanings.definition: Not able to be forgiven or excused.
meanings.sent1: The crime he committed was unforgivable.
meanings.sent2: Her betrayal was unforgivable to her best friend.
meanings.sent3: It was unforgivable how he ate the last cookie without asking.
meanings.sent4: The damage caused by the storm was unforgivable.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's unfair punishment was truly unforgivable.

meanings.definition: Deserving of no forgiveness or pardon.
meanings.sent1: The unforgivable act left a permanent scar on their friendship.
meanings.sent2: The criminal's actions were truly unforgivable.
meanings.sent3: It was unforgivable how he forgot their anniversary.
meanings.sent4: The unforgivable mistake cost them the championship.
meanings.sent5: The unforgivable lie shattered their trust completely.
